results.title: Apollo 1
results.creator_credit: Brian Grazer, Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, David Frankel, Clavius Base and Imagine Entertainment (US)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “From the earth to the moon”.
January 27, 1967. In preparation for the flight of Apollo 1, astronauts Gus Grissom, Ed White and Roger Chaffe undergo a routine test in their space capsule. The test turns into a disaster when a small electrical fire becomes a raging inferno - the lives of three men lost before they even leave the ground. The nation mourns, but the ever-watchful Senate Committee - anxious over the extreme haste and massive expenditure involved in the project thus far - may pull the plug on the entire Apollo project.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Grazer, Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, David Frankel, Clavius Base and Imagine Entertainment (US)

results.title: We have cleared the tower
results.creator_credit: Brian Grazer, Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, Clavius Base and Imagine Entertainment (US)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “From the earth to the moon”.
19 months and six unmanned flights after the Apollo 1 tragedy, Wally Schirra, Don Eisele and Walt Cunningham are set to become the first trio of American astronauts in space on Apollo 7 - their preparations followed every step of the way by a keen, young documentary crew. Noone can afford to make a mistake that might endanger the life of the mission or the lives of the men.

results.creator_credit: Brian Grazer, Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, Clavius Base and Imagine Entertainment (US)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “From the earth to the moon”.
In a year marked by anti-Vietnam war prtesets, when Russia seemed ready to send a man to the moon, Frank Borman, Jim Lovell and William Anders prepare for the launch of Apollo 8, the first ever manned voyage to the moon. Their aim is to reach the moon and remain in lunar orbit, the greatest risk is that they have a single engine that must break their orbit if it is to bring them home safely.

results.title: Once upon a time in the west = C'era una volta il West [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Sergio Leone, Fulvio Morsella, Paramount Pictures, Rafran and San Marco
results.brief_description: Leone took classic themes of the western revenge story and the coming to the Frontier of civilisation in the form of the railroad and reshaped them into a fresco-like narrative neither revisionist nor traditional. Western stereotypes are abstracted in a West so self-consciously relocated in fable and fantasy that it has been suggested by David Thomson that Leone at heart harboured a contempt for the genre. He and his writers certainly brought European sensibility to bear on American classicism frequently citing classic Hollywood westerns while dilating time and lingering on atmospherics at the expense of cause and effect, clarity and classical economy. Essential to the film’s affect is a symmetry between image and music (Morricone’s four basic musical themes were used to pace and construct scenes throughout the shooting) in an operatic “dance of death” in which “the arias are not sung, they are stared”. Cast includes Claudia Cardinale, Henry Fonda, Jason Robards, Charles Bronson and Gabriele Ferzetti.

results.title: Across the Pacific
results.creator_credit: John Huston, Jack Saper, Jerry Wald, First National Pictures and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Adapted from the ‘Saturday Evening Post’ serial of the same name name by Robert Carson, this taut World War II thriller reunites the stars of John Huston’s earlier hit,’ The Maltese Falcon’. Humphrey Bogart plays Rick Leland, a tough, cynical Army officer given a bogus dishonorable discharge and sent undercover to hook up with Japanese sympathisers on the eve of Pearl Harbour. Aboard a freighter bound for the Orient, he plays a ticklish game of matching wits with the enigmatic Dr. Lorenz (Sidney Greenstreet), spiced by the presence of the mysterious and beautiful Alberta Marlow (Mary Astor). Huston made this film the year after making his directorial debut with ‘The Maltese Falcon’, and like that classic, this film is full of cool and subtle characters, sharp dialogue, and a plot chock full of twists and turns.

results.title: Dekalog = The Ten commandments. Parts 6-10
results.brief_description: ‘The Ten Commandments’ according to Kieslowski are ten 55 minute dramas made as a television series (although two were also released in longer form as theatrical features), set in and around a Warsaw housing estate. Together they constitute something like an analysis of the shortcomings of contemporary Polish society, although the individual dilemmas are quite universal. The moral imperatives of the Commandments are tempered by an underlying sympathy for the characters. Parts 6-10 include: Thou shalt not commit adultery (58 min.)— Thou shalt not steal (55 min.)—Thou shalt not bear false witness (54 min.)— Thou shalt not covet thy neighbour’s wife (58 min.)—Thou shalt not covet thy neighbour’s goods (57 min.). Scripted by Krzysztof Kieslowski and Krzysztof Piesiewicz.

results.title: Dekalog = The Ten commandments. Parts 1-5
results.brief_description: ‘The Ten Commandments’ according to Kieslowski are ten 55 minute dramas made as a television series (although two were also released in longer form as theatrical features), set in and around a Warsaw housing estate. Together they constitute something like an analysis of the shortcomings of contemporary Polish society, although the individual dilemmas are quite universal. The moral imperatives of the Commandments are tempered by an underlying sympathy for the characters. Parts 1-5 include: I am the Lord thy God. Thou shalt have no other God but me (53 min.)—Thou shalt not take the name of the Lord thy God in vain (57 min.)—Honour the Sabbath Day (55 min.)— Honour thy father and mother (55 min.)—Thou shalt not kill (57 min.) Scripted by Krzysztof Kieslowski and Krzysztof Piesiewicz.

results.title: Nights of Cabiria = Le Notti di Cabiria
results.creator_credit: Federico Fellini, Dino De Laurentiis and De Laurentiis Entertainment Group
results.brief_description: Nights of Cabiria is Fellini’s bitter-sweet account of a resilient Roman prostitute desperate to find love and respect in marriage. Cabiria, played by Fellini’s wife Giulietta Masina, is the prostitute with a heart of gold who is in love with love. Endlessly searching for true love, Cabiria is continually disappointed by men - abused, deceived and betrayed - but she never loses hope. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Ugly, dirty and bad = Brutti, sporchi e cattivi
results.creator_credit: Ettore Scola, Carlo Ponti and Compagnia Cinematografica Champion
results.brief_description: Director Ettore Scola focuses on a large dysfunctional family living in a shanty town on the outskirts of Rome. The stingy patriarch, Giacinto, is personally wealthy but morally bankrupt, and his repulsive view of life trickles down to every member of his clan. Not content with corrupting his own flesh and blood, Giacinto spreads his philosophy throughout the entire village, where he functions as slumlord. Although the surroundings and characters exist at the lowest level of society, their misery is very funny at times, imbued with enormous energy in a daily fight to maintain their survival. In Italian with English subtitles. Cast includes Nino Manfredi, Maria Bosco and Giselda Castrini.

results.title: Trauma
results.brief_description: A mysterious 16 year old girl named Aura (played by Dario Argento’s daughter Asia) is saved from jumping off a bridge by David, a young graphic artist (Christopher Rydell). The troubled girl has just escaped from a sanatorium run by the sinister Dr. Judd (Frederick Forrest) and is terrified about going back there. Meanwhile a deranged killer who gruesomely dispatches his victims by decapitation is terrorizing the city. Aura finds herself safely back at her parents, an odd pair of Russian mystics (Piper Laurie and Dominique Serrand) but soon finds her life is in danger as the killer is somehow linked to her past. Argento’s delirious thriller threatens to derail at certain times, mixing explicit violence, eating disorders, romance and mysticism. However his stylish direction holds it together for the most part, only faltering right at the end with a ludicrous and extraneous credit sequence. Cast also includes Brad Dourif, James Russo and Laura Johnson. See also ‘Deep red’ (1975), ‘Suspiria’ (1977) and ‘The Bird with the crystal plumage’ (1970).
